title: AD PRO LIVE: The 2025 Interior Design Forecast Is Almost Here—Register Now for the Virtual Reveal
description: AD100 designer Adam Charlap Hyman and AD PRO Directory talents Noz Nozawa and Bradley Odom will spill their 2025 design predictions in this AD PRO LIVE virtual event

text: Come year-end, it’s natural to take stock of societal shifts and how they have shaped the way we live. A moment to slow down, reflect, and refine—to polish the silver, if you will. In AD PRO’s 2025 Interior Design Forecast, we’ll explore these influential factors (see: goals of less screen time, a return to candle-lit dinner parties at home, a renewed attention on sleep, and more) and consider the impact they will have on the spaces we inhabit.From there, we’ll look forward with gusto: How are floor plans evolving to accommodate such lifestyle shifts? What cutting-edge materials and amenities designers are eager to install in a client project? And most importantly, which of these upgrades have staying power?On November 19 at 1:00 pm ET, join AD PRO Associate Director Lila Allen in conversation with AD100 designer Adam Charlap Hyman and AD PRO Directory talents Noz Nozawa and Bradley Odom for this one-hour AD PRO LIVE virtual event, presented by Kohler. They’ll be spilling their 2025 design predictions—and you won’t want to miss it.Register hereAdam Charlap Hyman Principal, Interiors, Charlap Hyman & Herrero Adam Charlap Hyman has never let his title as Principal of Interiors at AD100 firm Charlap Hyman & Herrero keep him from creative endeavors of all typology. Alongside co-founder Andre Herrero, the New York- and LA-based practice has lended its avante-garde coolness to gallery exhibitions, opera stage sets, product lines, and more. Photography courtesy Charlap Hyman & HerreroNoz Nozawa Principal Designer, Noz Design Bursting with personality, Noz Nozawa’s spectrum of projects ranges from a cosmic psychedelia wet bar at the 2023 San Francisco Decorator Show House to the wild eclecticism of her own Bay Area home. Since its founding in 2014, AD PRO Directory firm Noz Design ensures there’s never a dull moment. Photography courtesy Noz DesignBradley Odom Founder and Principal Designer, Bradley Odom Interiors Bradley Odom is the founder and principal designer of AD PRO Directory practice Bradley Odom Interior Design. His curatorial eye mixes raw and refined, leading to authentic and artisan-led interiors. Odom is also the proprietor of Dixon Rye, a beloved trove of home goods new and old in Atlanta. html:
Come year-end, it’s natural to take stock of societal shifts and how they have shaped the way we live. A moment to slow down, reflect, and refine—to polish the silver, if you will. In AD PRO’s 2025 Interior Design Forecast, we’ll explore these influential factors (see: goals of less screen time, a return to candle-lit dinner parties at home, a renewed attention on sleep, and more) and consider the impact they will have on the spaces we inhabit.

From there, we’ll look forward with gusto: How are floor plans evolving to accommodate such lifestyle shifts? What cutting-edge materials and amenities designers are eager to install in a client project? And most importantly, which of these upgrades have staying power?

On November 19 at 1:00 pm ET, join AD PRO Associate Director Lila Allen in conversation with AD100 designer Adam Charlap Hyman and AD PRO Directory talents Noz Nozawa and Bradley Odom for this one-hour AD PRO LIVE virtual event, presented by Kohler. They’ll be spilling their 2025 design predictions—and you won’t want to miss it.
